intro: [WRONG START] Hieracius meieces, commonly known as the lesser hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow flowers arranged in a single head. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. It has hairy stems and leaves that are typically lance-shaped. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
